pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Shinzo Abe, Prime Minister of Japan | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Yesterday, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan.

The two leaders discussed and reiterated their commitment to ensuring an early entry into force of the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP). The prime ministers also discussed the ministerial meeting on World Trade Organization reform being held in Ottawa on October 24-25.  The two leaders welcomed the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) and how it provides a secure and stable environment for trade in North America. Noting the upcoming international economic engagements in November, they reaffirmed both countriesâ€™ continued commitment to free, open and progressive trade that benefits the middle class.

The Prime Ministers exchanged views on the latest developments in Saudi Arabia, including the recently released G7 ministerial statement on the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi. The leaders reaffirmed their commitment to upholding human rights, including protecting journalists and promoting freedom of expression.

Prime Minister Trudeau and Prime Minister Abe agreed to keep in contact and plan to meet on the margins of an upcoming Summit.
